text: Bottle 330ml. Totally black with big, light-brown head, good lacing. Aroma is chocolate, cacao with delicate, sweet note of vanilla, intense and very nice. Definitely dry, a little bit roasty, chocolate, coffee and subtle sour note from malt in aftertaste. IÂ’m surprised there is no vanilla in taste, maybe tiny, sweet note in the finish. Beer is medium body, dry, quite light, medium carbonated (a little bit too much), very good sample of stout but I expected more notes of bourbon barrel but there are quite poor but noticable. Anyway very tasty stout.
Bottle- pours black tan head - nose and taste of coffee, chocolate, roasted oat and bourbon - medium body

Pours a viscous black body with a fizzy, dark brown and short-lived head that ends up as a partially covering film and some build-up at the walls. Strong aroma of dark roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate and wood, with dark dried fruits in the back. Strong flavour of dark roasted malt, coffee, and dark and bitter chocolate. In the back I find wood, tobacco, ash, fruitiness and hints of peat(!). Surprisingly light sweet taste with a long-lasting and rather heavy bitter finish. Mid-bodied, dry on the palate, moderate carbonation. I nice one, although I would have liked it less dry. And since this is a bourbon edition, I guess it would be fun if there was actually some bourbon present. 
[33 cl bottle, from Vinmonopolet Online]
backlog. Loads of french roast in the aroma. Slight bourbon vanilla note. Silkier than the orginal, barrel is subtle. Pretty nice but a bit of a weak body to bare the barrel

0,33l bottle at home. Did not find the BB date. almost black color, small dark-coffee-colored head. smells of light ash, earthy notes, light bourbon, coffee, bitter chocolate, marzipan. lovely smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of ash, charcoal, bitter herbal, light coffee, some bitter chocolate, light lactic creaminess. finishes rather roasty bitter with notes of bitter herbs, ash and light chocolate. good one but quite on the roasty / bitter side (too much ash and charcoal). could use a bit more balance / a bit more creaminess, but overall still quite nice.

Bottle. Black with small tan head. Aroma has bourbon and chocolate, light vanilla. Flavour is bourbon boozy, light notes of chocolate. Mouthfeel goes from medium body to somewhat light in the finish and the bourbon is slightly over to top for my taste.

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2016 Bottle at home. Pours pitch black, beige foamy head that nicely laces the beer. Dark coffee and chocolate, butterscotch, caramel, vanilla, light red fruits, very light bourbon. Roasted malty, medium bitter aftertaste. Soft mouthfeel, medium carbonation, medium body (too thin imo to be a world class stout).

Bottled. Pours deep brown nearly black with an average a creamy, tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, chocolate, licorice, vanilla and bourbon. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry, with alcohol and slightly bitter. Medium to full bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Stout. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ
Bottle at home, bought at Geers. Bourbon, vanilla, roast, light bitter and a little sour. Missing the coffee that the regular offers, but the vanilla is also nice in this one.
33cl bottle from cervezalandia. Dark color. Thin persistent beige head. Medium bitterness, light sweetness. Dry body. Roasted beans, chocolate, hops, liquorice, cacao, fruit, light whisky.

N: restrained bourbon. Licorice and smoked malt. Dark or maybe burnt chocolate cake. Thinish mouthfeel initially. T: Again restrained flavours mostly on roasted and dark chocolate flavours. Bitter and roasted aftertaste

33 cl bottle @ home
BBE should be on the cap but it is empty
Aroma has coffee and licorice. Feels nice and somewhat rich. Flavour has salty licorice, mild rubbery tones, coffee, tobacco and ash. Rather ashy and dry finish. A bit confusing; some elements are nice here and some are not.

330ml bottle
Pours pitch black with a smooth brown head. Aroma of coffee, hops, roasty malts, hints of vanilla, very mild notes of wood and oak. Taste is smooth, slick and slightly roasty with some coffee, wood, vanilla, hints of hops and ash. Finish is roasty and earthy with hints of coffee, vanilla, oak and berries. Okay, bourbon is quite hidden here.

33 cl bottle.
Pours jet black color with a small head. Aroma is tangy coffee, licorice, citric fruit notes, faint tar, dark malts and chocolate. Flavor is surprisingly fruity, dark chocolate, vinous, burnt notes, some coffee and dark malts. A bit tangy palate, woody and dry, not very pleasant. CanÂ’t really locate the bourbon here. Disappointing.
4324
Draught at Mikkeller Tokyo. Chocolate cake, vanilla, almond, bourbon, fairly sweet finish with a boozy edge. Obviously a light version of the series, tasty but not so exciting.

Pours a dark dark brown with a small beige head that leaves pretty good lacing. Nose is of heavy roast, umami, light coconut and bourbon. Taste features the same heavy roast and doesnÂ’t seem too sweet and moderately bitter. Some unfortunate ash. Powdered cocoa and coffee. Both body and carbonation were average and there is a light acridity that IÂ’m not a fan of but at least it doesnÂ’t hinder drinkability. Body could be a little fuller too but nothing bad. Overall a really good stout, lose the ash and acridness and this could very well be world class!

bottle shared by mathieuc, thanks bro! pours unclear dark brown with a nice beige cap, reviving and leaving nice lacing. nutty chocolate, velvety hazvery elnut spread, red wine, strong coffee, lactose drop, nutty coffee - complex grains; clean yeast. moderate carbonation, light to medium body; semi-sweet and drying earthy-woody-coffee finish. solid bourbon barrel-aged coffee stout.
Tap at Tokyo. Black with lace. Nose is bourbon, vanilla, cookies. Boozy bourbon flavor, coffee, vanilla. Very light. Tasty but thin and a bit weak. Approachable though.
Poured into Glencarin glass from bottle. Aroma is sweet oak coffee slightly leaning on the oak. Dark brown head. Strong coffee flavor. Feels slightly undercarbed but very well drinkable.

Pitch black color. Dark brown color. Smooth creamy nose with cappuccino and bourbon. Lovely bourbon, creamy mouth with lots of dark chocolate, ash and oak. Low carbonation. Bourbon is a bit subdued but well integrated.

December 29, 2015. Bottle, shared by rlgk, thanks!

Black with a small brown head. Aroma is roasted coffee, green peppers, licorice, dark chocolate, wet wood light bourbon notes. 

Taste is light sweet, slightlt dry bitter roastiness. Finish is roasted coffee, quite bitter, some chocolate and wet wood notes, licorice. Medium bodied, a bit dry thin finish, average carbonation.

Pours black with a brown thin head. Aroma; bourbon, roasted malt, dark chocolate, liqourice, wood, a touch of vanilla and smoke with some alcohol notes. Flavours; chocolate, liqourice, wood, a touch of dried dark fruits, roasted malt and bourbon.

Bottle courtesy of rlgk. Pours pretty much black with a small mocha head that doesnÂ’t leave much trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty with roasted malts, burnt caramel, dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, roasted green paprika, moist soil and hints of bourbon alcohol. Taste is slightly sweet, bitter, malty and tiny vegetal. Mouthfeel is soft, round, astringent and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and bitter with roasted malts, dark bread, charred wood, dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, roasted paprika, moist soil and hints of alcohol. Too heavy on the vegetal notes.

A: Almost black with a slightly red colour. N: Bourbon, dark berries, oak, vanilla, hint of coffee T: Coffee, green peppers, wet wood O: Quite light (might be the lineup...) flavours. Light barrel taste.

Bottle at a Gothenburg tasting in our apartment 151229. Opaque black beer with a small brownish head. Roasted woody aroma, bourbon, vanilla, dark chocolate, licorice, tar notes, some peat. Roasted woody flavor, peat notes, dark chocolate, licorice, some hay. Quite nice.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet AKer Brygge, a while back. Pitch black color, good foam. Medium/high aroma intensity; roasted, barrel influence, some boozy aromas, leather and licorice. Medium/ full body & complexity. Quite sweet, bitterness balances good- but ends up a little on the sweet side. Very enjoyable

Black with a thick Brown head fading quickly into a tiny ring. Big charred aromas with hints of smokiness and booze. Medium to full body, really whisky focused with some heavy alcohol notes. Finishes a bit thin for the style, altough it makes it an "easier" sipper. Not bad.

Bottle (330 ml). Split 2-ways. Black with reddish reflects and a medium brown head that leaves a ring of tan foam. Aroma is really enticing, super complex but also really well balanced. Roasted malts, bourbon, vanilla, coffee mild fruity presence and dark chocolate. Taste isnÂ’t as deep as aroma but thatÂ’s close and also pretty tasty... bourbon, roasted malts, dark chocolate, mild acidity, vanilla and pretty much no sign of alcohol. Medium body. ItÂ’s probably the only area where the beer could you some decent upgrade because itÂ’s a bit thin for the style. Finish is fruity - coffee fruity. Excellent bourbon barrel-aged stout with a great balance and loads of flavors.

Bottle split 2 ways. Pretty still black brown pour. Aroma is really rich and bourbony, great roasty coffee aroma, light leathery notes, vanilla, light fruitiness, very good. Taste is lightly sweet, nice rich roasty flavor, dark chocolate, tons of coffee. Palate is med-full bodied with soft carbonation, not too sticky. Very nice.

330 ml bottle. Pitch black body with a small beige head. Strong aroma of roasted malt, oak and coffee with some vanilla and alcohol. Flavor is sweet, roasted malt, coffee, oak, decent bitterness and more vanilla and oak than actually bourbon. Full bodied and long lasting aftertaste. Very pleasant.

The aroma is full of coffee, chocolate, vanilla, roasted coffee, smoke, tar and bourbon whiskey. The color is pitch black. The taste is full of coffee, chocolate, vanilla, smoke and tar along with some small notes of bourbon. A really nice beer!

Bottle @ Christers. Pours pitch black with a creamy brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, rich bourbon, wood, light vanilla, some dark fruit. Flavor is malt, coffee, dark chocolate, caramel, wood, bourbon. Medium body, soft carbonation. 061015

Bottle, 7.5%. Black with medium brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bourbon and vanilla. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, vanilla, bourbon, medium sweet, hop, liquorice, dark chocolate and medium bitter.
Bottle. Nice dark brown head. Color is intense black. Aroma and taste are rich roast malt, chocolate, caramel, cocoa, bourbon and hops. Nice dry and smooth finish. Lovely beer.
Fonefan 110415. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, caramel, bourbon. Flavour is roasted malt, coffee, caramel, vanilla, bourbon, chocolate. Very nice beer.

33 cl bottle. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma is dark roasted to almost tarish. Thick liqourice, roasted and wooden. Herbal to tarish dry malt. Vague fruity. Bitter, dark and dry, roasted. Dry dark malty finish.

Lukt: Kaffe, bek, lakris, vanilje og sjokolade.
Utseende: Sort.
Skum/kullsyre: tynt dekkende brunt skum.
Smak: kaffe, lakris, mye mÃ¸rk sjokolade og vanilje.

Bottle at home. Pours a pitch black color with a light brown head. Roasted aroma of coffee, vanilla, oak, leather chocolate truffles and liquor. The flavor is even more roasted with more oak, leather, coffee, ash and very dark chocolate. Has a slick and silky mouth feel and lingering, balanced bitterness. The bourbon is well presented along with a nice roasted touch. A real dessert beer.

Bottle at home. Pitch black . brown head. High malty. Burned. Dry burned malts. Ok bitterness. Vanilla. Ok coffee. Nice bourbon sweetness. Licorice. Burned malty bitterness. Wooden tannins. Dry, bitter and acidic finish.

Couleur brune foncÃ©e presque noir, mousse moka foncÃ©e. Senteur de cafe, bourbon, malt rotie avec une touche sucrÃ©e. Au gout, le cafÃ© ressort en premier, puis la barrique. Le tout avec une bonne rondeur en bouche et une assez bonne amertume. Bonne biÃ¨re, selon moi meilleur que la version originale, toutefois je prÃ©fÃ¨re de loin ls sÃ©rie brunch weisel.
Poured deep dark brown, disappearing beige head. Aroma of roast malt, coffee, dark chocolate. Medium to full body, flavour as the aroma, fairly smooth.

Une mousse mince et fugace se pose sur un liquide noir et opaque. CÂ’est surtout du bois mouillÃ© dÂ’alcool qui ressort au nez, avec quelques effluves vanillÃ©s. Les caractÃ©ristiques de la Beer Geek Breakfast originale sont bien goÃ»tÃ©es en bouche, le passage en barriques de bourbon se manifestant plus quand la biÃ¨re tempÃ¨re. CÂ’est plutÃ´t mince malheureusement, je prÃ©fÃ¨re la version de base.

Bottle from mikkeller bar
alcohol, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, woody, smoke, black, hazy, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish
Impressive considerinh the ABV. Tried a brunch version before and this is better overall
Bottle. Black oily pour, small brown head. Aroma of gritty coffee, roast, vanilla, whiskey and choco. Flavor of rich coffee, sweet vanilla, cherry, cacao and creamy milk. Fantastic.
Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen. Pours black with light brown head. Sweet, roasted malts, cocoa, chocolate, vanilla, wood, note of bourbon. Medium to full bodied.

Bottle at home. Tried it as the name suggested, with my breakfast. Black pour, thin tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, vanilla, oak, bready and with some chocolate. Flavor is quite bitter, roasted, smooth and very well balanced. Slightly thinner body than the original version, but that doesnÂ’t hurt here. Nice one.

Bouteille. JÂ’ai bien aimÃ©Â´ce stout oÃ¹ le fÃ»t de whiskey est bien intÃ©grÃ© parmi les saveurs de chocolat, de cafÃ© et de vanille. La texture passablement visqueuse est bien agrÃ©able en bouche. Un oatmeal stout pour dÃ©jeuner de grande qualitÃ©.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a tiny tan head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, coffee, vanilla, dark chocolate, and a hint of bourbon Â– with a bitter finish.

Bottle from VP Bestillingsutvalg enjoyed at home
Pours pitch black with a big brown head. Smell of liquorice, tar, coffee, vanilla , bourbon and roasted malts. Moderate sweet, alot of oak, bourbon, vanilla, coffee, quite dry palate, quite chewy, alot of oats in the back. Earthy moderate bitter finish. Well crafted, elegant, nice barrel edition. But as often with Mikkeller, the original is better

Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends. Black color, brown head. Bitter taste with coffee, nuts, oak, bourbon, hops and roasted malts. Bitter finish with coffee, a bit of chocolate, nuts, oak and roasted malts.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Mikkeller Beer Geek Breakfast (Bourbon Edition) ].ABV: 7.5%. Clear dark brown black color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, light brown head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, sweet malt, cacao - chocolate, alcohol - bourbon - vanilla. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, cherry stone - wood, roasted, chocolate, wood. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150411]

Totalmente negra, espuma marrom escura, cremosa. Aroma intenso de cafÃ©, um resquÃ­cio alcoÃ³lico que remete a destilados, fumo. Sabor com amargor mÃ©dio, dulÃ§or leve, corpo denso, alcoÃ³lica, baixa carbonaÃ§Ã£o. Aftertaste intenso, onde foi possivel identificar a adiÃ§Ã£o de aveia, notadamente o cafÃ©.

Mar 2015 - 330ml bottle from Mikkeller online shop. No details of ABV or date. Black, small brown head. Aroma is coffee, pine, some toffee and vanilla, liquorice. Body is medium to light, slightly foamy, low carbonation. Taste is light with some spice, toffee, some piney hop, very soft barrel, touch of coffee. Nice flavour, nice balance.

33 cl. Le corps est bien noir et sa tÃªte foncÃ©e laisse des traces en se retirant. Le nez exhibe des parfums de malts rÃ´tis, de cafÃ©, de chocolat et de vanille nuancÃ©s par le fÃ»t de bourbon. Le goÃ»t est quant Ã  lui structurÃ© par des saveurs de malts rÃ´tis et terreux, par du bois brÃ»lÃ©, par un aspect floral du bourbon et par des grains de cafÃ© qui viennent dÂ’Ãªtre tournÃ©s. En bouche, le corps mÂ’apparaÃ®t Ãªtre moyen-mince. Je me demande si la texture nÂ’a pas Ã©tÃ© lÃ©gÃ¨rement mangÃ©e. En arriÃ¨re-goÃ»t, lÂ’amertume de torrÃ©faction est robuste et assez tenace.

Bottle with thanks to Bursprak. Pours opaque black, small brown head, slow to dissipate, nice lacing. Aroma is bourbon, chocolate, coffee, and roasted malt. Flavor is light plus sweet, medium bitter, roasty bourbon, a bit watery actually. Lightish body. Solid.

Bottle 33cl. Pours pure black. Small beige head. Smell is bit vanilla, dark malts. Taste is bit bitter, coffee, intense, grainy a bit as well. Dark malts. Only mild bourbon, more oaky. Bit of vanilla. Too thin mouthfeel for my taste, especially compared to past beers by them.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, chocolate, hint of smoke, coffee, some vanilla, some peaty notes, espresso, hint of Bourbon. Flavour is light to moderate sweet with a moderate bitter finish. The Bourbon touch is subtle.Very smooth and enjoyable.

Bottle. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, vanilla, roasted grains, chocolate and caramel. Flavor is sweet and malty with some roasted notes, vanilla, caramel, coffee, warming alcohol and oak. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, oak, vanilla and some hops. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter with a long roasted, chocolate, caramel, vanilla and oak finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. It pours a dense, finger-thick tan head over a black body. The aroma is roasted, in a coffee way, with dry, dark chocolate and a touch of booze. Vanilla. ItÂ’s full-bodied, lightly warming and soft on the carbonation, with flavors of dark chocolate, coffee and a little boozy touch. Woody notes tannins and bitterness. Everlasting finish. Perhaps a bit too influenced by the booze, but sure nice anyway. 150522

Bottle: Chouffe glass:
Black beer with a quick disappearing brown head.
Aroma of honey, roast, light bourbon, raisin, light earthy, some coffee, chocolate and light light vinous...
Flavour has chocolate with coffee, roast, light wood, light liquorice/more bayleaf, bitters, some choco coal, wood and malt burn and coffee beans...
Aftertaste is roast, chocolate, mocha, wood burn, bitters, some coffee/coffee beans...
Low carbo, more creamy than watery mouthfeel, more than medium bodied.
I miss the Bourbon!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Svart farge med lavt brunt skum. Aroma av kaffe, noe vanilje og rÃ¸stet malt. Muligens et hint av mÃ¸rk kakao ogsÃ¥. SmÃ¥bitter smak av kaffe og noe kakao samt lakris. Medium kropp.

Bottle @ THLBBT May. Pours a dark brown beer with a small beige head on top. Aroma of bourbon, coffee, malts and some caramel fudge. Flavor is sweet with touches of coffee and some bittersweet molasses in the aftertaste. Lacks a bit complexity, but this is basically an alcoholic breakfast for sure.

330 ml. bottle. Thanks Nikos! Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of malt, coffee, chocolate, and bourbon. Taste is roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, and bourbon. Not quite a Home Run.

Bottle. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty woody bourbon and chocolate aroma. Roasted malty woody bourbon chocolate and coffee flavor. Has a roasted malty woody bourbon and chocolate finish.

Dark brown colour, cinnamon coloured small head on top and some lacing. Aroma has syrup, roasted malts, some fruits and coffee. No sign of the bourbon in the aroma. Taste has brown sugar, roasted malts and coffee. Slight bourbon flavour in the end. Full body with low carbonation. A bit mild bourbon finish for my taste.

A black beer, a head is weak but a colour is beautiful, dark brown. Aroma has strong roastiness and black coffee, vanilla, some sweetness. Enjoyable. Taste has strong coffee and roastiness, not totally dry. Only medium bodied, smooth low carbonation. The great aroma, the roasted and coffeeish taste isnÂ’t the same. Enjoyable and very good beer, anyway.

Bottle at home, poured a dark Black colour with a Nice beige head. Aroma of dark charred espresso beans, green chili, cacao, vanilla, sweet bakers chocola, milk chocolate, thereÂ’s some charred smoky oak in the aroma, and marshmallow, but i couldnÂ’t detect any Bourbon in the nose. Strong bitter coffe in the taste, full bodied mouthfeel, but again no Bourbon in the taste. Def. Not worth the 3x extra price tag compared to the regular beer geek breakfast
Bottle @ WWT IV, small sample. Dark color, short head. Aroma of roasted malts, bit coffee. Malty bitterness. WhereÂ’s the bourbon? Just on the label I guess. Disappointing really.
Bottle at WWT. Black with beige head. Old coffee, very dry cocoa beans, wood, bitter herbs, some metallic notes. Quite bitter and dry. Medium bodied leaning towards the light side.

Bottle shared at WWT IV. Pours near black with a ring brown head. Aroma of roast, licorice, dark chocolate, toffee. Flavour is over moderate sweet and heavy bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Not so much bourbon.

Bottle sampled at WWT IV.
Very thin tan head. Clear black pour. Light bourbon

Bottle @ WWT IV. Opaque pitch black color, average sized light brown head. Smell and taste malts, a hint of wood, clearly barrel aged but it doesnÂ’t really strike me as bourbon imo, firm roast, roast bitter. Medium body, decent carbonation.

Taste is roasted malts, coffee, bourbon, chocolate, vanilla notes. Full body. Oily texture. Slightly bitter roasted finish. Quite good.
(bottle 17/04-2015) low brown head, black color, smooth roasted Bourbon taste, soft co2.

33cl bottle @Dangerous Bottleshares 7.0. Pours a pitch black with a small, brown head. Aroma has lots of fruity coffee, roasty malts, coffee berries, hints of oaky bourbon, vanilla. Taste of roasty and coffee bitterness, slight sweet malt and vanilla, but almost no bourbon presence. Some lactose-like sweetness, probably from the oatmeal. Ends off very dry with lots of coffee. Medium full body, medium carbonation.

Sort skum brun lidt kort 
Kaffe trÃ¦ stÃ¸v vanjile 
Bitter modrtar sÃ¸d modrate 
Oile blÃ¸d @f1

Bottle @ Post-Easter Procrastination, Ulfborg. Pours cloudy very dark brown with airy tan head. Clear aroma of malt, caramel, vanilla, coffee and barrel. Roasty flavour with notes of barrel and vanilla, and touches of coffee and liquorice. Bitter and roasty aftertaste. Very decent.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Black with a brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and bourbon. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish. 110415

Bottle 33cl, a dark beer with medium copper head. Nose is on brown caramel, dark malt, licorice, plum. Aroma is on a creamy dark chocolate, apricot and prune body, dark malt astringency, oak notes, less vanilla hints, intense espresso finish. Easy drinkable, good creamy body.

Bottle. It pours jet black with a creamy beige head. The aroma is roasted coffee and vanilla with roasted notes. Oak, ash, roast and vanilla notes in the flavor. Not much bourbon notes tbo. Coffee ashy notes in the finish.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottle Share 7.0. Pitch black with a small tan head. Nose has coffee, roasty notes, ash and some light chocolate. Taste has fresh coffee, subtle barrel notes, vanilla fudge, roasty, tar and some light caramel.

330 ml. bottle. Procured by Kraddel. Joint purchase. Drank Â½. Blackish brown. Sweet umami, bourbon, sugar, lots of bourbon vanilla, light soy in the nose, touch bitterness. The new beer geek breakfast is thicker, more roasted & bitter than the original, also better in my opinion. Taste is bourbon, lots of bourbon sugar, vanilla, lots of sugar, quite bitter, touch herbal, soy, plenty of roast mixed with the big bourbon sweetness. Easy body, touch lower carbonation. Quite nice.

Pours pure black. 
Small white head. Smell is bit vanilla, dark malts. Taste is bit bitter , coffee, intense, grainy a bit as well. Dark malts. Only mild bourbon , more oaky . Bit of vanilla. OK . Too thin mouthfeel for my taste, especially compared to past beers by them.

Bottle shared @ the ever awesome dangerous bottleshare #7 . Pours black with a brown head, The aroma is pretty coffee forward, fresh light roasted coffee indeed. Also some vanilla, sweet liquorice, cocoa beans and some weak milky sweetness. The barrel is very subtle here. The taste is also coffee forward with some dry woody notes, vanilla, liquorice, a milky sweetness, oatmeal, roasted malts and fruity coffee. Really really good. But the barrel is very low key. Beer geek breakfast is a fine ass beer and this is no exception. Liked it better than the old bourbon edition!

20-MAR-2015, bottle @home, from Kihoskh.
Black with lasting Brown head.
Aroma is whisky and roast. Taste is whisky, coffee, chocolate, peat. Creamy, medium++ body, medium carbonation. Nice.

Shared at Dangerous Bottleshare #7. Pours pitch black with a small dark brown head. Aromas of coffee, light smoke, licorice, bourbon, some vanilla, oats, chocolate, some green-ish notes. Taste is roasted, licorice, salmiak, light green coffee, chocolate, vanilla, very little bourbon, dry woody finish. Slightly disappointing.

330ml bottle at home. Black color with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, coffee, wood - whiskey and vanilla notes in the beginning, light chocolate, smoked - tar notes. Light sweet and heavy bitter taste like the aroma. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Pitch dark brown, faint swirl film and sticky thin brown ringed. Sticky dates, vanilla and light burn. Initial taste is choc, soap dust and neat sweetness. Cooling enough, not overly cloying. Finish is softly sweet and the coffee firmly comes through for a steely linger. Bottle, Mikkeller Online, Sake Monday Tasting
Bottle. Black with tan head. Aroma of bourbon, coffee, chocolate, not too powerful. Taste of bourbon, roasty, oak, burnt, coffee. Quite thin with a long finish
Bottle at CraigÂ’s. Pours black, nose is quite soapy, fairy liquid, vanilla, taste is dry roasted, coffee, chocolate, again quite soapy, disappointing.

bottle at home ... deep black ... thin tan lacing ... soft dark chocolate roast ... light whisky ...dark malts ... dark chcoolate roast ... dry chcolate ... long soft whisky linger ... whisky fades to leave some ligth coffee on linger ...
Bottle at CraigÂ’s. Pours black with a thin tan head. Aromas of coffee, light booze, bourbon. Taste is coffee, soapy, thin. Dry finish. Lots of coffee at the end.

33cl bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours pitch black with a tan head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, oak and some bourbon. Flavour is medium bitter. Medium bodied, carbonation is soft. Finish is coffee and bourbon.

Bottle. Pours pitch black, very small brown head, leaving nice ring on side of glass. Aroma is coffee, vanilla, cake. Burnt malts, dark chocolate. Taste is rich, medium sweet, burnt caramel, oaky vanilla, dry oak and roasty coffee finish. Some cocoa powder too. Some smooth oath mouthfeel. Quite caky for the ABV but could have used some more body, because itÂ’s quite potent. Light to medium body and medium carbonation.

330 ml bottle poured into a snifter. 7.5% ABV, light pink/flesh colored Keith Shore label. Jet black with thin tan sporadic head. Aromas of bourbon, toasted oak, roasty notes, dark chocolate, coffee. Tastes of dark chocolate, roasty notes, oak, balanced bourbon, coffee. Medium-full body with a dry finish. Would like just a bit more barrel character.

Fresh batch. Pour is pretty darn black, with a small mocha brown head. 
Aroma of oatmeal, coffee beans, some hops, slight chocolate, subdued bourbon vanilla notes, roasted malts, slight smoke to it. A mixture of the green hoppy stuff, with delicious sticky bourbon sweetness. I do prefer the sweet sticky stuff, so Maybe six months in the celler would do this beer good, to me atleast. Taste is slightly sweet up front, with a somewhat heavy bitterness. Medium bodied, with a flat but pricking carbonation. I like this no doubt, but a bit "green" for my likings.
